summary: This document is a chain of emails from August 2019 between officials at the Financial Crimes Enforcement Network (FinCEN) and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, discussing the sharing of FinCEN records (specifically Suspicious Activity Reports - SARs) related to the Jeffrey Epstein investigation. The emails show coordination to ensure the prosecution team has all relevant financial intelligence.

persons.name: Ori
persons.context: Appears to be the primary correspondent from FinCEN, sending emails to coordinate the sharing of FinCEN records (SAR information) with the SDNY Epstein prosecution team.

connections.description: Ori is corresponding with Ma, copying them on an email to ensure FinCEN records are circulated to their team.

events.title: Follow-up on FinCEN Records Sharing
events.description: Ori follows up on a previous request to circulate FinCEN records related to Epstein to the team.

events.title: Confirmation of Information to Share
events.description: An Assistant Chief Counsel at FinCEN confirms they have information (SARs) to send to the SDNY Epstein team.

events.title: Introduction and Coordination Initiated
events.description: A Co-Chief from the SDNY's Money Laundering Unit introduces FinCEN counsel to AUSAs on the Epstein team to coordinate the sharing of SAR information.

keyFacts: FinCEN officials were actively coordinating with the SDNY prosecution team in August 2019 to share Suspicious Activity Report (SAR) information related to Jeffrey Epstein.
The email chain demonstrates inter-agency cooperation (FinCEN and SDNY) to ensure all relevant financial intelligence was available for the Epstein investigation.
The correspondence highlights the use of FinCEN Query and specific document IDs to pull financial records, indicating a structured process for sharing financial crimes data.
Multiple individuals' email addresses are partially redacted, indicating the document is from a released set with standard privacy redactions.
